summary: Email correspondence between attorneys regarding a Rule 17(c) subpoena filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's counsel seeking information from the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund. The government attorney informs Jack Scarola of the motion and states intent to file a motion to quash, while Scarola notes the confidentiality of disclosures to the Fund.

persons.name: Jack Scarola
persons.context: Attorney receiving and responding to an email about a subpoena targeting the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund, noting the confidentiality of disclosures to the Fund.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Her counsel filed a motion seeking to subpoena information from the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund.

connections.description: Scarola is involved in correspondence regarding a subpoena filed by Maxwell's counsel, indicating an adversarial legal relationship concerning the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund.

events.title: Motion to subpoena Epstein Victim Compensation Fund
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's counsel files a motion seeking a Rule 17(c) subpoena for information from the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund, including information about a specific individual.

events.title: Email correspondence about subpoena opposition
events.description: Email exchange discussing the subpoena, with the government attorney stating intent to file a motion to quash and Jack Scarola emphasizing confidentiality of Fund disclosures.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's counsel filed a motion seeking a Rule 17(c) subpoena for information from the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund.
The government attorney intended to file a motion to quash the subpoena, citing expectations of confidentiality.
Disclosures to the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund were made under assurances of confidentiality.
The email correspondence reveals legal maneuvering around victim compensation information during Maxwell's prosecution.
